derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from Latin, ablative of via 'way, road'

entry.def: If you go somewhere via a particular place, you go through that place on the way to your destination.

example.ex: We drove via Lovech to the old Danube town of Ruse...
example.tran: 我们开车经由洛维奇到达了多瑙河畔的古镇鲁塞。

example.ex: Mr Baker will return home via Britain and France.
example.tran: 贝克先生将取道英国和法国回国。

entry.def: If you do something via a particular means or person, you do it by making use of that means or person.

example.ex: The technology to allow relief workers to contact the outside world via satellite already exists...
example.tran: 能够让救援人员通过卫星与外界联系的技术已经存在。

example.ex: Translators can now work from home, via electronic mail systems...
example.tran: 翻译人员现在可以利用电子邮件系统在家里工作了。

Sentence.sentence: They'll be able to answer the questions of students who are in their class directly via the interactive book.
You'll also be able to receive email, music and movies, all via an internet link.
It is the most prominent example of a huge new "sharing economy", in which people rent beds, cars, boats and other assets directly from each other, co-ordinated via the internet.
The music service This Is My Jam helps people navigate the tens of millions of tracks now available instantly via Spotify and iTunes.
Just connect via videoconferencing software, so your face appears on Ava's screen.
